pros: Great benefits and the people are nice
cons: A lot of change occurring. So much change.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Marys, GA
pros: Compassionate Coworkers. Close with no traffic anywhere in county.
cons: Management is your first step out the door. Rinse. Repeat. Unending cycle with this establishment. Stay on a unit. Get your OT. Don't accept any salaried or management position.

pros: Good place to work. Good benefits

pros: Patient Safety focus with new leadership. Really turning things around.

review_title: Used to be a wonderful place to work!
pros: Great benefits. Annual increases. Onsite gym. Top-notch providers.
cons: CEO turnover. Senior leadership turnover. Community Board to involved in day to day when focus should be on future, strategy and how to keep the health system from being gobbled up by bigger, for-profit health systems.

review_title: Camden campus ED , good for learning managment runs everyone off
job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Saint Marys, GA
pros: colleagues were nice and encouraged learning.
cons:
- pay is SIGNIFICANTLY less than the area standard
- management will seek out opportunities to give you the short end of the stick if you are not the bubbly, friendly type. Then if you try to go to HR to report/complain you get blown off.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Brunswick, GA
pros: Friendly atmosphere and attitude among staff in all departments. Generally a good teamwork vibe with nurses among all floors. Very knowledgeable professionals that are trying to do their best in an unsupportive system.
cons: Management is the major reason I left this facility. There is no support for staff. You are expected to work unsafe patient ratios. The attitude from management/leadership is that you are replaceable and if you don’t like it leave. There are no true raises, merit raises, or appreciation of long term staff. There is no foresight into long term problems and planning.

job_title: Medical Office Assistant in Brunswick, GA
pros: Nice people for the most part, a lot of perks
cons: Not enough pay, bad management

review_title: Do not care much about people
pros: Learned new skills, helped make some patients smile, met some sweet people.
cons: Horrible pay for working in COVID units, emotional/verbal abuse from management and some doctors, lack of recognition, large problem with cliques, lack of empathy from some staff, unable to access all the PTO that was built up, damaging environment for self confidence and mental health, awful schedules, management does not know your job description, bad communication, unfair prices/unnecessary and duplicate tests for patients, lack of cleanliness in some areas.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Kingsland, GA
pros: Great support system in place for team members. Feel very supported by management.
cons: Short staffed at times, but that is normal for healthcare right now.

cons: Only one: CMS (Medicare & Medicaid) and their constant cuts of reimbursements.  This will cripple all but the top hospitals in the US.

pros: It is a great place to work. Teamwork is a major characteristic.
